title: Explosions Damage Crimea Bridge as Russia Blames Ukraine for Attack
description: Russia accused Ukraine of hitting the Kerch Strait Bridge for the second time in 10 months, saying that two maritime drones had struck the bridge, an essential supply line for Russian troops.

title: More Than 50 Whales Die After Being Stranded in Scotland
description: Only one pilot whale survived out of the 55 beached on the Isle of Lewis in northwest Scotland on Sunday. It was the largest mass stranding in the region in over a decade.

title: Russia Halts Participation in Ukraine Grain Deal
description: Moscow, which has repeatedly complained that the U.N.-brokered agreement is one-sided in Ukraine’s favor, said it could return to the deal if its demands were met.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: China Engages as Its Economy Sputters
description: Also, an attack on a bridge between Russia and Crimea.

title: In a Bid to Curb Migrants, Europe Strikes a Deal With Tunisia
description: After the deadliest shipwreck in decades in the Mediterranean, E.U. officials will pay Tunisia to prevent migrants from setting to sea.

title: Mystery Object Is Found on Remote Beach in Western Australia
description: The authorities said the cylindrical object, which was found about 155 miles north of Perth, did not pose a risk to the public, but they have yet to identify it.

title: Israeli President Herzog’s White House Visit Highlights Biden’s Anger At Netanyahu
description: President Isaac Herzog of Israel visits Washington this week. Benjamin Netanyahu, the Israeli prime minister, has yet to receive a similar invitation this year.

title: Wagner Convoy Arrives at Camp in Belarus
description: The troop movements are the private company’s biggest — and most public — showing since its failed rebellion in Russia last month.

title: Iran Steps Up Policing of Women Who Violate Strict Dress Code
description: The country’s morality police disappeared from the streets late last year as the authorities tried to calm anti-government protests. Now, patrols are once again watching for violators.

title: What We Know About the Crimea Bridge Attack
description: Monday’s strike was the second in less than a year to target the Kerch Strait Bridge, which holds strategic and symbolic importance for Russia.

title: Where Is Qin Gang, China’s Foreign Minister? Beijing Won’t Say.
description: Qin Gang has not made a public appearance in three weeks. The Communist Party’s habitual secrecy around top officials has fueled speculation over the reasons for his absence.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Explosions on Crimean Bridge Disrupt Key Link to Russia
description: A deadly attack on the Kerch Strait Bridge was the latest blow to a Russian military already dealing with internal strife.

title: Wildfire in Canary Islands Forces Thousands to Evacuate
description: The blaze on the island of La Palma has driven some 4,000 residents from their homes and burned about 10,000 acres. It could be a harbinger of weather-related crises this summer in Europe.

title: What’s Next for Israel’s Judicial Overhaul?
description: Israeli lawmakers are advancing parts of a contentious plan by the right-wing government to reduce the power of the Supreme Court. A final vote is expected by early next week.

title: A Positive Covid Milestone
description: In a sign that the pandemic really is over, the total number of Americans dying each day is no longer historically abnormal.

title: Russia says it has suspended participation in the grain deal.
Far From the Front, They Stand in Honor of Ukraine
description: The city of Chernivtsi in western Ukraine has been spared the mayhem of the Russian invasion. But like other towns in the region, it is doing its part, and has become, in effect, a back office of the war effort.

title: House Committee Targets U.C. Berkeley Program for China Ties
description: A House select committee is requesting more information about a university collaboration that it said could help China gain access to cutting-edge research.

title: Kerry Says U.S. and China Must Set Aside Politics to Tackle Climate Change
description: John Kerry, President Biden’s climate envoy, is in Beijing for three days of talks between the world’s largest emitters of greenhouse gas pollution.

title: Riots in France Highlight a Vicious Cycle Between Police and Minorities
description: Calls to overhaul the police go back decades. But violent episodes of police enforcement continue. So do violent outpourings on the street.

title: Kerch Bridge in Crimea Attacked by Ukraine, Russian Bloggers Say
description: Russian military bloggers reported that Ukraine had attacked the Kerch Strait Bridge, although Russian and allied authorities in Crimea only described the episode as an “emergency.”

title: Russia’s Embassy in Washington is enmeshed in a different kind of war.
Your Monday Briefing
description: Britain’s troubled health service.

title: Why Does Every Women’s World Cup City Have Two Names?
description: A concerted effort to say Indigenous names correctly, and tell the stories behind them, will show up in stadiums in New Zealand and Australia.
